html:
4.4.24  10:37 pm   what do you like most about drywall?

      its comedic value, clearly

4.4.24  10:01 pm   should i learn how to play the drums

      maybe

4.4.24  6:10 pm   do you have perfect pitch? I feel like you would have it

      it's weird that people think that, but it's actually the less musical people who have it. it's the ability to remember absolute pitches non-musically. over the course of my life i've sort of retroactively hacked my brain to be able to do such a such a stunt, but what's far more important than that, for me, is that i have the ability to easily and instantly recognize pitches with perfect musical accuracy. this is ironically not called 'perfect pitch'

4.4.24  3:59 pm   what's your favorite appliance?

      the switch

4.4.24  3:54 pm   Probably been asked before, but is there any particular key you keep coming back to? And is there any particular reason for that?

      i favor all 12 keys equally EXCEPT possibly C. i don't avoid C too seriously, but i think there is a mild tendency to avoid it because i think on some deep level it probably sounds the most bland because it's the most used by beginners (maybe? probably?). but when C turns out to be the best key for the vocal, i try to remind myself that it's not a crime to be in C. However, i have to also mention the elephant under the rug here, which is that in saying that i prefer these 12 (or 11) keys equally, i'm also saying that i also stick to A=440 tuning. now, in terms of freshness, it would actually be much much better to throw it somewhere else. but on the other hand, the reason i keep it in 440 is as a courtesy to practicing musicians who like to noodle along to their playlist and then get fucked when something like 'beat it' comes on, for example

4.4.24  1:54 pm   What are the chances of this question being answered?

      1

4.4.24  1:44 pm   Dear Bill Wurtz,

Hey, I love your music! Your one of my favorite artists! I have a question.

Akira Toriyama recently passed, the author of Dragon Ball. Do you have any thoughts on his passing or Dragon Ball?

      no, and i have a good reason for this. it's because i have never seen dragon ball. but that doesn't mean it isn't good

      a

      probably with your knuckles

      i actually don't know what a biome is

4.4.24  9:29 am   How's progress on your next thing?

      good

4.4.24  8:52 am   oftentimes when im making comics or writing music, i find myself repeatedly and distractingly discontented, frustrated, and agonized over the aesthetic and structure of the english language. i feel like my woes can only be quelled if i invent my own language to do stuff in, but that might take upwards of my whole life. should i go on with making my own language, or should i stop being a baby and just do it all in english?

      there is a 3rd option, which is to learn another existing language, for a fresh perspective. it might even spice up your english. doing a conlang will also give you some perspective, now that i think about it. conlangs are totally different from real languages, and it's almost impossible for conlangs to have the natural (and sometimes unexplainable) quirks that develop in real languages. but you might learn something along the way. you might also notice that there is no native speaking audience of your conlang, which may bring you straight back to english. then again you might also notice something similar if you learn a real language with a smaller population of speakers than english. but that will also give you some perspective. either way you will learn something. what the heck, do the whole thing in numbers maybe

4.4.24  8:28 am   Say something you think is really funny.

      seriousness

4.4.24  8:05 am   waffles or pancakes

      both, assuming you are asking me which ones you've mentioned

4.4.24  7:38 am   How many of your songs are supposed to be about us?

      any time you assume a song is specifically about me, i will usually jump to the conclusion that is about you. just to give you an idea of what that feels like, for such an assumption to be made

4.4.24  7:16 am   do you believe that you are not an average person compared to everyone else? (Please answer this question seriously thanks in advance)

      i have many similarities and differences to other people

      it's funnier not to do it

      yes but that's normal. this is an important challenge we all must face. i think we all solve it differently. exciting to see what your method may be

4.3.24  7:04 pm   so i'm writing some short songs to produce, but during the writing i'm facing the unexpected issue of "how do i know they're actually supposed to be short songs instead of continuing into full songs?" like, some of them feel like they wanna keep going, but i definitely didn't intend for that to be the case when i started writing

      if the song wants to continue, then it wants to continue. but it doesn't mean you have to work on that now. if your intended work task right now is to write short songs, then save the longer song for another time and try again to write a short one

4.3.24  1:31 am   what do you think of the court lingo of saying "my lord", "lordship",...? i find it pretentious!

      i've never heard of this except in fiction. so therefore it has a very fictional/unrealistic sound, to me

4.3.24  12:22 am   what are your thoughts on grammar?

     it grows naturally, over time

     obviously some grammatical things aren't that important. like capitalizing the start of every sentence - a lot of people don't do that, because the meaning of the sentence is still clear without it. but that kind of reasoning only goes so far - to an experienced english speaker, a sentence like "where car go?" is probably still going to be recognizable. but it's clearly not grammatically right. and no one would speak like that on purpose. so, when do you think a grammatical mistake goes from being ultimately irrelevant to being an actual impedement to understanding?

      for example, if someone wants to tell you that they've closed the door, they might say, with fairly minor grammar mistakes, "i'm close to the door"

4.3.24  12:11 am   im invested in the ways of grooving; could you give a couple tips since you seem quite groovy

      basically it's about the interplay between the expected and the unexpected, in any given situation. so basically whatever is expected, and whatever is unexpected. mix those 2 elements to taste

4.2.24  10:12 pm   how do i get an absurdly wide vocal range like freddie mercury or paul mccartney or someone? do i just have to be born with that, or can i actually practice to do that?

      i'm not entirely sure

4.2.24  7:54 pm   What's your opinion on compound words?

      that would be a different opinion for each compound word, and then if you include an opinion for each of the individual word elements within the word, that could be up to 3 opinions per word. but it doesn't stop there: my opinion of a word is gonna be totally different for each different way and time it can be used
